item.content:encoded:
Universiti Malaya’s Tawfik Yaakub says the initiative will only succeed if led by a professional figure who transcends political partisanship.

(FMT) – A political analyst has questioned the ability of Bersatu president Muhyiddin Yassin to spearhead a “national unification agenda” to strengthen Malay solidarity.

Tawfik Yaakub of Universiti Malaya said the initiative would only succeed if led by a professional figure who transcends political partisanship, and is respected across all factions and widely accepted as its leader.

If stakeholders insisted on having a politician at the helm, Tawfik suggested a younger leader with fresh ideas who could command confidence across the political spectrum, including within the government.

“If the call for Malay unity comes solely from one side and is not reciprocated by Malay political parties within the government such as Umno and Amanah, this effort will be futile,” he said.

“There must be collaboration across all parties and organisations, not to change the government but to mainstream the voices and rights of the Malay community.”

Tawfik was responding to a proposal by Bersatu’s newly elected Wanita chief, Mas Ermieyati Samsudin, who suggested that the former prime minister lead a cross-party agenda involving Malay organisations and key leaders.

Mas Ermieyati said the call was to strengthen Malay unity, which she claimed had weakened to the point that other communities felt emboldened to challenge Malay privileges.

Comparing Bersatu’s current strength to that of its ally PAS, which has more seats and resources, Tawfik said: “His (Muhyiddin’s) time has passed.”

He also dismissed Mas Ermieyati’s proposal, describing it as a “common syndrome of those without power” and as seeking attention from the Malay community.

He said empowering the Malays should involve addressing non-political issues such as poverty.

“This would resonate more deeply with the Malay community and translate into political influence, rather than recycling political issues that further divide them,” he said.

Ariff Aizuddin Azlan from Universiti Teknologi Mara however expressed confidence in Muhyiddin’s ability to lead the agenda, describing him as a prominent opposition figure capable of rallying political allies behind the initiative.

To gain widespread support, Ariff said Muhyiddin should craft a clear narrative and articulate objectives in simple, relatable terms.

“If this movement is to be framed more broadly, Muhyiddin must remain open and receptive to public opinion,” he said.

He added that engagement with academics and intellectuals should also be considered to ensure a more holistic formulation of policies and effectively position the agenda in society.

item.content:encoded:
Bersatu’s bank accounts have been frozen by MACC as part of its probe into the party linked to the Covid-19 stimulus packages.

(FMT) – Bersatu is in a “critical” financial position as its accounts are still frozen by the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission, said party treasurer Rina Harun.

Rina said Bersatu has found it difficult to carry out activities, particularly at the grassroots level.

The former women, family and community development minister said steps should be taken to generate financial resources, including getting Bersatu divisions to start businesses.

“I will find ways to resolve this problem,” she said at the Bersatu general assembly here today.

“I also want to mobilise the treasurers at the state and division levels to generate income and economic activity, at least to allow the divisions to function independently.”

Yesterday, Rompin Bersatu chief Abdul Khalib Abdullah proposed that all divisions and committees begin raising funds since the party’s accounts are frozen.

The party organised a donation drive at the start of the general assembly on Friday.

In February 2023, MACC chief commissioner Azam Baki confirmed that several bank accounts held by Bersatu had been seized after they were frozen as part of the agency’s investigation into the party.

The probe is linked to the alleged misappropriation of funds for Covid-19 stimulus packages amounting to RM92.5 billion by the former Perikatan Nasional-led government.

Bersatu later filed an application in the High Court to challenge the MACC over the freezing of its accounts, accusing it of abusing its powers to conduct “selective prosecution” against PN.

item.content:encoded:
A Bersatu leader has urged party members to focus on building support rather than relying on political “waves” to win elections.

(NST) – “How can we win elections if we continue relying on waves? Waves will eventually stop,” said vice-president Datuk Seri Ronald Kiandee in a speech at Bersatu’s annual general assembly today.

“When we lost in Pulai, we said it wasn’t our seat. True, it was the opposition’s seat.

“But when we lost in Nenggiri, what was our excuse? Wasn’t that our seat too? It was our seat, our candidate, our party.

“We have no excuses because the real reason is that we were relying on the wave,” he said, adding that the party had failed to commit to expanding its influence.

In August, Barisan Nasional captured the Nenggiri seat in a by-election, defeating Perikatan Nasional’s (PN) candidate from Bersatu.

Kiandee noted that in last year’s state election, PN’s success was largely attributed to the prevailing political wave at the time.

However, he said, the wave subsided during the Nenggiri by-election as voter support shifted.

“Let’s get to work, don’t just wait for the wave. PN also needs to be strengthened.

“We want to discuss appointing the prime minister, and we are even arguing over the poster boy role on social media, turning it into a media polemic. Meanwhile, others hide their weaknesses.”

item.content:encoded:
(FMT) – Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah tidak berkenan dengan cadangan Universiti Putra Malaysia (UPM) ditukar nama kepada Universiti Pertanian Malaysia.

Sultan Selangor bertitah, cadangan itu tidak dirujuk kepadanya selaku canselor UPM dan Lembaga Pentadbir universiti terlebih dahulu.

“Baru-baru ini, beta membaca kenyataan Menteri (Pertanian dan Keterjaminan Makanan), Mohamad Sabu yang mencadangkan untuk menukarkan semula nama Universiti Putra Malaysia kepada Universiti Pertanian Malaysia.

“Di sini, beta menegaskan nama Universiti Putra Malaysia ini hendaklah dikekalkan kerana beta telahpun melancarkan jenama Putra yang membawa maksud ‘Pertanian Untuk Rakyat’,” titah baginda menurut Sinar Harian pada Majlis Konvokesyen UPM Ke-48 (Sidang 2) di Serdang.

Baginda bertitah, Universiti Putra Malaysia turut mengambil nama sempena Perdana Menteri pertama, Tunku Abdul Rahman.

“Beta ingin mengingatkan kepada mereka yang tidak memahami sejarah agar membaca dan meneliti fakta sejarah sebelum membuat apa-apa kenyataan, terutama melibatkan Universiti Putra Malaysia.”

Kelmarin, Mohamad yang juga dikenali Mat Sabu dilaporkan berkata, beliau akan membawa cadangan penukaran Universiti Putra Malaysia kepada nama asalnya Universiti Pertanian Malaysia ke Jemaah Menteri selepas mengambil kira keutamaan negara kini memfokuskan isu keterjaminan makanan dan memajukan sektor pertanian.

Penukaran nama Universiti Pertanian Malaysia kepada Universiti Putra Malaysia pada 3 April 1997 bagi menggambarkan status UPM sebagai institusi pendidikan tinggi yang bukan saja menawarkan program pengajian dalam bidang pertanian, sebaliknya pelbagai bidang lain, terutamanya sains dan teknologi maklumat.

UPM kini mempunyai 14 fakulti pengajian menawarkan pelbagai program berkaitan bidang pertanian dan keterjaminan makanan, termasuk penggunaan teknologi kecerdasan buatan serta pertanian pintar.

Source : Free Malaysia Today

item.content:encoded:
Adalah tidak munasabah bagi Ahli Parlimen Muar, Syed Saddiq Syed Abdul Rahman sebagai pemimpin sayap parti politik, tidak mengetahui pengeluaran RM1 juta daripada akaun ARMADA BERSATU, kata Hakim Mahkamah Tinggi, Datuk Azhar Abdul Hamid.

(BH) – Beliau berkata, penafian Syed Saddiq bahawa beliau mempunyai pengetahuan mengenai penyimpanan dan kegunaan wang RM1 juta itu juga adalah sesuatu yang sukar diterima akal.

“Mahkamah juga tidak bersetuju dengan keterangan Syed Saddiq bahawa beliau tidak dimaklumkan mengenai jumlah sebenar wang yang dikeluarkan, sebaliknya berpendirian, tindakan tertuduh selaku Ketua ARMADA ketika itu yang juga seorang daripada pemegang amanah akaun, mengarahkan pengeluaran wang RM1 juta tanpa kelulusan Majlis Pimpinan Tertinggi BERSATU, adalah kesalahan pecah amanah,” katanya dalam penghakiman Mahkamah Tinggi yang menjatuhkan hukuman penjara tujuh tahun dan denda RM10 juta serta dua sebatan terhadap Syed Saddiq pada 9 November tahun lalu.

Ia selepas mahkamah mendapatinya bersalah terhadap empat tuduhan pecah amanah, salah guna wang dan pengubahan wang haram dana ARMADA BERSATU.

Azhar membuat dapatan itu menerusi alasan penghakiman setebal 22 muka surat yang diperoleh pihak media melalui laman web mahkamah, hari ini.

Beliau berkata, tindakan menyimpan dan membahagikan wang tunai yang dikeluarkan tanpa disimpan di tempat yang selamat di pejabat ARMADA juga menimbulkan satu inferens niat jahat di pihak tertuduh.

Sementara itu, Azhar berkata, tiada satu pun keterangan dikemukakan Syed Saddiq menunjukkan kutipan majlis makan malam (ARMADA) yang akan diadakan adalah untuk menggantikan perbelanjaan yang dibuatnya sebelum ini.

Sebaliknya, hakim itu berkata, ia adalah untuk menampung kempen pilihan raya bekas Menteri Belia dan Sukan itu.

“Kronologi dan tarikh menunjukkan pemindahan wang RM100,000 daripada akaun Armada Bumi Bersatu Enterprise (ABBE) kepada akaun peribadi Maybank tertuduh berlaku sebelum Pilihan Raya Umum ke-14 (PRU14) berlangsung.

“Pemindahan wang itu ke dalam akaun Amanah Saham Bumiputera (ASB) milik Ahli Parlimen Muar itu pula berlaku sebulan selepas pilihan raya.

“Penyata bank yang dikemukakan tidak menunjukkan sebarang pengeluaran yang boleh dikatakan sebagai perbelanjaan bagi kempen pilihanraya. Justeru , dakwaan bahawa tertuduh sudah membelanjakan wang beliau sendiri juga tidak disokong mana-mana keterangan.

“Tanpa sebarang bukti untuk menyokong fakta ini, dakwaan yang wang terbabit adalah untuk menggantikan wang tertuduh sendiri juga tidak berasas,” katanya.

Azhar sebelum ini membenarkan bekas Presiden Parti Ikatan Demokratik Malaysia (MUDA) itu menangguhkan pelaksanaan semua hukuman, manakala syarat jaminan dikekalkan sementara menunggu rayuan di Mahkamah Rayuan.

Sementara itu, Azhar berkata, sebagai seorang Ahli Parlimen dan idola anak muda, Syed Saddiq sepatutnya menunjukkan contoh yang baik.

“(Ini supaya) untuk beliau terus menjadi ikutan anak-anak muda, selain melaksanakan tanggungjawab seorang yang dipilih rakyat Muar dalam memperjuangkan hak mereka.

“Mahkamah juga mengambil kira ini kesalahan pertama tertuduh. Selain itu, usia tertuduh yang masih muda juga menjadi pertimbangan mahkamah ini.

“Pada usia ini, tertuduh masih mempunyai banyak masa lagi untuk menyedari dan memperbaiki kesilapan dilakukan serta mengambil iktibar daripada apa yang berlaku,” katanya.

Susulan itu, Azhar berkata, mahkamah berpendapat hukuman diberikan adalah munasabah dan berpatutan.
